item.title: 气候谈判转向开采关键矿产的风险
item.description: 各国越来越倾向于敲响警钟，警惕开采和加工关键矿物的危险，因为它们试图强调，在摆脱化石燃料的过渡过程中，不应以采用肮脏材料取而代之。【原文：Nations are edging closer to sounding the alarm about the perils of extracting and processing critical minerals, as they seek to emphasize the transition away from fossil fuels shouldn’t be replaced by an adoption of dirty materials instead.】

item.title: 气候抗议活动重返 COP30，在民主巴西举行
item.description:
联合国气候峰会多年来一直在独裁国家举行，活动家们再次举办活动，敦促各国加大力度、加快步伐。【原文：

After years of UN climate summits in authoritarian countries, activists are again staging events to urge countries to do more and move faster. 

】

item.title: 大雨来临前，洛杉矶、马里布泥石流威胁上升
item.description: 洛杉矶地区受火灾影响的居民区正在准备应对预计周五深夜将到来的破纪录降雨可能造成的泥石流威胁。【原文：Fire-stricken neighborhoods in the Los Angeles area are preparing for the threat of mudslides from potentially record-breaking rains expected to arrive late Friday night.】

item.title: 南非的全球环境影响力因政治争斗而削弱
item.description: 南非通常在全球气候和环境论坛上大放厥词，但由于一场导致其环境部长被解雇的政治斗争，南非的影响力受到削弱。【原文：South Africa, a normally vocal presence in global climate and environment forums, has eroded its influence because of a political fight that led to the firing of its environment minister.】

item.title: 联合国称 COP30 需要安全升级和更好的空调系统
item.description: COP30 第一周的闭幕充满戏剧性。联合国正在向巴西抱怨安保松懈和半成品设施让代表们在酷热中汗流浃背。抗议者将于周五动员起来。澳大利亚和土耳其正在争夺下一届缔约方大会的主办权。【原文：The first week of COP30 is wrapping up on a dramatic note. The United Nations is complaining to Brazil about lax security and half-built facilities that have left delegates sweating in oppressive heat. Protesters are set to mobilize on Friday. And Australia and Turkey are fighting over who gets to host the next COP.】

item.title: 欧洲追踪甲烷排放的首次尝试未能成功
item.description: 由于一些德国公司没有提交数据，欧盟首次甲烷排放清单（甲烷是导致全球变暖的最主要因素之一）一开始就困难重重。【原文：The European Union’s first inventory of methane emissions — one of the most potent drivers of global warming — is off to a rocky start, with some German firms not submitting their data.】

item.title: 日本最大核电站必须等待更长时间才能获得重启许可
item.description: 一位掌握着世界上最大核电站命运的日本地区长官说，自他上次访问以来，闲置核电站的安全措施有所改善。【原文：A Japanese regional governor who holds sway over the fate of the world’s largest nuclear power plant said security measures at the idled facility had improved since his last visit.】

item.title: 后期热浪过后，中国发电量创 20 个月来最大增幅
item.description: 随着热浪席卷中国南部地区，中国的发电量在 10 月份创下了自 2024 年 2 月以来的最大增幅。【原文：China’s power generation surged the most since February 2024 in October as a heat wave swamped the southern part of the country, with coal power plants picking up the slack amid slow growth in renewables.】

item.title: CATL 仍希望西班牙允许 2000 名中国工人在其电池厂工作
item.description: 电池巨头当代安培科技有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.据该公司的一位高管称，该公司仍在与西班牙政府就一项计划进行谈判，计划让 2000 名中国工程师、技术人员和管理人员参与在萨拉戈萨（Zaragoza）建立一个价值 41 亿欧元（48 亿美元）的生产厂。【原文：Battery giant Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. remains in talks with Spain’s government over a plan to have 2,000 Chinese engineers, technicians and managers work on establishing a €4.1 billion ($4.8 billion) manufacturing plant in Zaragoza, according to a company executive.】

item.title: 中国首次寒潮导致全国气温骤降
item.description: 未来几天，中国将迎来本季节的第一次寒潮，预计全国各地的寒冷程度将超过正常水平，这可能会影响电力需求。【原文：China will see its first cold wave of the season in the coming days, with chillier-than-normal conditions expected across the country, which may impact power demand.】

item.title: 特朗普解除对北极数百万英亩土地的石油钻探限制
item.description: 特朗普政府取消了对阿拉斯加州庞大的石油储备的石油钻探限制，推翻了前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）将约 87 亿桶可开采石油列为禁区的举动。【原文：The Trump administration rescinded restrictions on oil drilling in Alaska’s mammoth state petroleum reserve, reversing a move by former President Joe Biden that put an estimated 8.7 billion barrels of recoverable oil off limits.】

item.title: 德国缩减建设燃气发电厂的庞大计划
item.description: 德国联合政府中化石燃料和清洁能源的支持者达成了一项妥协协议，将新建 20 千兆瓦天然气发电厂的计划削减了一半。【原文：Germany cut in half its plans to build 20 gigawatts of new gas-fired power plants in a compromise deal between proponents of fossil fuels and clean energy in the country’s coalition government.】

item.title: 澳大利亚和土耳其就双方都希望主办的峰会发生争执
item.description: 澳大利亚和土耳其都在争夺明年联合国年度气候峰会的主办权。【原文：Australia and Turkey are both vying to host the annual United Nations climate summit next year, a contest that on Thursday broke into full view at the current talks in Brazil.】

item.title: 联合国命令巴西改善 COP30 的安全和恶劣条件
item.description: 一名联合国高级气候官员要求巴西当局立即制定一项计划，以解决在贝伦市举行的 COP30 会议上出现的安全漏洞、气温飙升、洪水和其他恶劣条件。【原文：A top UN climate official demanded Brazilian authorities immediately develop a plan for addressing security lapses, soaring temperatures, flooding and other poor conditions at the COP30 conference in the city of Belém.】

item.title: 洛杉矶为暴雨和潜在洪水做好准备
item.description: 未来几天，随着太平洋沿岸暴雨和暴雪的形成，加利福尼亚州将被淋成落汤鸡，可能给洛杉矶带来一个月的降雨量，并引发去年 1 月大火焚烧地区的疏散警告。【原文：California is set to be drenched in coming days as heavy rain and snowstorms uncoil off the Pacific Ocean, potentially bringing Los Angeles a month’s worth of rain and prompting evacuation warnings in areas burned by last January’s fires.】

item.title: 巴西在 COP30 上试图向怀疑论者推销 "低碳牛肉
item.description: 巴西肉类行业正在发起一场运动，让全世界相信它可以生产低碳排放的牛肉；一些专家说，这种说法掩盖了牛肉对气候造成的严重影响。【原文：Brazil’s meat industry is mounting a campaign to convince the world it can produce beef with low carbon emissions — a claim that some experts say obscures beef’s heavy toll on the climate.】

item.title: 代表们起草路线图，化石燃料之争在 COP30 上硝烟弥漫
item.description: 这一切都与化石燃料有关，伙计们。今天是个好日子，我们要记住，这两个神奇的字眼是在 28 届缔约方会议上才被写入正式文本的。当2023年在迪拜出现这两个词时，它们是各国承诺过渡到不使用化石燃料的一部分。在第三十届缔约方会议上，化石燃料从一开始就占据了中心位置。【原文：It’s all about fossil fuels, folks. Today’s a good day to remember it took 28 COP editions for these two magic words to make it into an official text. When they did, in 2023 in Dubai, it was as part of a commitment by countries to transition away from them. At COP30, fossil fuels have taken center stage from minute one.】

item.title: 大科技公司的气候战略家感受到人工智能电力需求的压力
item.description:
高能耗数据中心考验着业界到 2040 年实现零碳排放的承诺

【原文：

Energy-hungry data centers test industry’s commitment to go carbon-zero by 2040

】

item.title: 一些国家在 COP30 上寻找化石燃料出路
item.description: 两年前，在迪拜举行的 COP28 会议上，全世界同意过渡到不再使用化石燃料。在 COP30 上，有一个新兴的运动正试图将其变为更具体的现实。【原文：Two years ago, at COP28 in Dubai, the world agreed to transition away from fossil fuels. At COP30, there’s a nascent movement trying to make that a more concrete reality.】

item.title: 毛里求斯商业银行为 Karpowership 提供 4 亿美元贷款
item.description: 毛里求斯商业银行有限公司（Mauritius Commercial Bank Ltd.）表示，它牵头为全球最大的船载电站供应商 Karpowership 的非洲分部筹集了 4 亿美元的银团贷款。【原文：Mauritius Commercial Bank Ltd. said it led the raising of a $400 million syndicated loan for the African unit of Karpowership, the world’s biggest provider of ship-mounted electricity plants.】

item.title: 澳大利亚反对党放弃 "净零 "目标，总理就气候问题向联合国示好
item.description: 澳大利亚主要反对党自由党放弃了到2050年实现净零排放的承诺，这可能会使总理安东尼-阿尔巴内斯为主办旗舰性全球气候峰会赢得支持的努力复杂化。【原文：Australia’s main opposition Liberal Party dropped a commitment to hit net zero emissions by 2050, potentially complicating Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s efforts to win support to host a flagship global climate summit.】

item.title: 伦敦富人正视家门口的洪水风险
item.description: 伦敦正在努力适应洪水更加频繁、威力更大的现实，其富裕地区正成为风险最大的地区之一。【原文：As London struggles to adapt to the reality of more frequent and powerful floods, its wealthier corners are emerging as some of the most at risk.】

item.title: 气候捐助方表示，更热的地球需要新玩法
item.description:
随着全球齐聚巴西参加第三十届缔约方大会，如何保护人类健康免受气候变化日益加剧的影响日益成为人们关注的焦点。【原文：

As the world gathers for COP30 in Brazil, there’s a growing focus on how to protect human health from the intensifying effects of climate change.

】

item.title: EDP 力争到 2030 年向亚洲绿色项目投资 20 亿美元
item.description: EDP SA 计划到 2030 年在亚洲的可再生能源和电池项目上投资高达 20 亿美元，尽管该公司已撤出该地区一些前景不佳的市场。【原文：EDP SA is planning to invest up to $2 billion on renewable energy and battery projects in Asia through 2030, even as the company pulls out of some less promising markets in the region.】

item.title: 二氧化碳排放量今年将再创新高
item.description:
与化石燃料使用相关的全球排放量正在上升，而此时地球上的天然碳汇吸收的二氧化碳正在减少。【原文：

Global emissions tied to fossil-fuel use are rising at a time when the planet’s natural carbon sinks are starting to absorb less CO2.

】

item.title: 这是埃克森公司拖延气候变暖的新策略吗？
item.description:
这家石油巨头正在推行一种新的碳核算方法，这令气候倡导者感到担忧，但也表明，尽管特朗普对低碳能源发起了攻击，埃克森仍在坚持其减排目标

。【原文：

The oil giant is pushing for a new carbon accounting method, which worries climate advocates but shows Exxon is sticking with its emission-reduction goals despite Trump’s attacks on low-carbon energy

】

item.title: 宾夕法尼亚州采取行动退出地区碳交易市场
item.description: 宾夕法尼亚州民主党州长夏皮罗（Shapiro）签署了一项法案，退出旨在减少温室气体排放的区域市场。【原文：Democratic Pennsylvania Governor Shapiro signed into law a bill to exit a regional market meant to cut greenhouse gas emissions, just over three years after the state joined the initiative to flight climate change.】

item.title: 研究称，过量降雨每年导致孟买损失 12 亿美元，并造成 2,700 人死亡
item.description: 一项新的研究显示，在孟买，暴雨造成的死亡人数远远多于公开记录中的数字，约占印度金融首都季风季节死亡总人数的 8%，在截至 2015 年的十年间，每年造成的损失达 12 亿美元。【原文：Severe rains killed far more people in Mumbai than listed in public records, accounting for roughly 8% of all deaths in India’s financial capital during the monsoon season and $1.2 billion in losses every year in the decade through 2015, a new study shows.】

item.title: 俄勒冈州野火索赔增加威胁伯克希尔旗下 PacifiCorp 公司评级
item.description: 伯克希尔哈撒韦能源公司（Berkshire Hathaway Energy Co.【原文：A Berkshire Hathaway Energy Co.-owned utility is at risk of losing its investment-grade credit rating as it expects to have to pay up more money for litigation brought by victims of 2020 wildfires in Oregon.】

item.title: 电池公司联手部署钠离子动力系统
item.description: 两家电池公司正在联手实施一项计划，在美国部署依靠钠离子技术的储能系统。【原文：Two battery companies are joining forces with a plan to deploy energy storage systems in the US that rely on sodium-ion technology.】
